data.name: Reward Me Fixed Rate Home Loan
data.description: With our Reward Me Home Loan, we keep our rates low so you could keep more money in your pocket

features.additionalInfo: Our Reward Me Home Loan comes with a Home Loan Companion Account that we'll open for you. The Companion Account will make it easier to make repayments and pay any fees and charges. Plus, you can use the account to offset the interest on your variable rate home loan or when you revert to a variable rate to help you pay the loan off sooner.
Additional repayment up to $10,000 per annum allowed on all fixed rate terms.

You can split and keep a portion of your borrowings with a variable rate to retain more flexibility. That way you'll have some protection if rates rise during your fixed rate period, but maintain some flexibility with the variable portion of your loan to make extra repayments or access funds through redraw if things change
Ask us to lock in a rate at the time of application for up to 100 days to protect yourself from any potential rate rises until the lending date. Fees and charges apply.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individual and joint personal applicants, no companies or trusts
Purchase or refinance of residential property
Purchase of vacant land & construction (home & land package

fees.name: Cheque dishonour Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $15 for each item. Banking of cheques only available at settlement.

fees.name: Settlement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable for completing settlement of your loans

fees.name: Notice to Tenant Requiring Vacant Possession Fee
Application Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable for processing application of your loans. Charged at settlement

fees.name: Call Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Charged whenever we visit you after a default has occurred.

fees.name: Rate Lock Fee
fees.additionalInfo: 0.15% of fixed rate loan amount. Payable if you request to lock in a specific fixed rate prior to the end of your current fixed rate period.

fees.name: Home Loan Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Charged to each loan account on every repayment date (monthly)

fees.name: Mortgagee Sale Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Charged for each property we hold as security for a loan facility where the lender commences mortgagee sale procedures (whether or not a sale is completed).

fees.name: Legal Review Fees - Standard
fees.additionalInfo: Payable for each document that the Lender is required to review, amend or prepare and which is categorised by the Lender as a standard document. A standard document may include but is not limited to: - review of a consent document, power of attorney or a caveat; or - amendment or preparation of a consent document, deed of covenant, confidentiality agreement,cross guarantee and indemnity, deed of subordination, fixed charge or a deed of priority.

fees.name: Break Cost Admin Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when we break your fixed rate contract. This fee is payable regardless of whether a break cost is incurred or not

fees.name: Default Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable 10 days after a repayment date if you have not paid your repayment or any other payment in full on or before that repayment date.

fees.name: Valuation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: First Valuation - Free. Any further valuation will be charged for. The amount of the fee, will be the fee charged by the appointed Valuer and will vary depending on the location and value of the property

fees.name: Legal Review Fees - Complex
fees.additionalInfo: Payable for each document that the Lender is required to review, amend or prepare and which is categorised by the Lender as a complex document. A complex document may include, but is not limited to: - agreements/deeds; or - amendment or preparation of a mortgage over lease, right of entry, mortgagee�s consent to lease.

fees.name: Break Costs
fees.additionalInfo: At cost. Actual break cost amount will depend on the cost incurred by the Lender. The amount is calculated in accordance with your loan agreement and may be payable if: A fixed rate period is broken (by you paying out the loan or changing loan types or as aconsequence of a default causing the full amount of the loan to fall due for payment); or You pay more than the total of your elected repayments plus $10,000 in any 12 month periodduring your fixed rate period; or A Break Cost event occurs and we make a loss from re-arranging our funding.
